snippet: An effort to develop an easy way for consumers to avoid being tracked and targeted by Internet advertisers appeared to have hit an impasse Thursday.
abstract: Effort to develop an easy way for consumers around the world to avoid being tracked and targeted by Internet advertisers appears to hit an impasse, as privacy advocates and industry representatives accuse each other of scuttling the process.

headline.main: Privacy Advocates and Advertisers at Odds Over Web Tracking
headline.print_headline: No Resolution Is Reached In a ‘Do Not Track’ Effort

snippet: Chrisann Brennan, Steve Jobs’s high school girlfriend and the mother of his daughter, will tell the story of her relationship with Mr. Jobs in a memoir to be published next year.
abstract: Chrisann Brennan, Steve Jobs’s high school girlfriend and the mother of his daughter, will tell the story of her relationship with Mr. Jobs in a memoir to be published next year.

headline.main: Steve Jobs's High School Girlfriend to Publish Memoir
headline.print_headline: Jobs’s High School Girlfriend To Publish a Memoir

snippet: 10 pear salads to make you forget about apples. For a while, at least.

Facebook announced that it was the first social network to reach one billion active users on the site. Although a few companies can claim to have had more than a billion customers, Facebook is the first social network to hit that number.
abstract: Facebook announced that it was the first social network to reach one billion active users on the site. Although a few companies can claim to have had more than a billion customers, Facebook is the first social network to hit that number.

headline.main: A Billion Users Raise Stakes at Facebook for Revenue
headline.print_headline: Billion Users Raise Stakes At Facebook For Revenue

byline.original: By SOMINI SENGUPTA and NICK BILTON

snippet: Why some students believe they must cheat, new e-readers let in more light, hackers breach 53 universities and post personal data online and other consumer-focused news from The New York Times.

headline.main: Thursday Reading: Why Some Students Believe They Must Cheat

snippet: There are some better options than Google and Apple for mapping and navigation.
abstract: Kit Eaton App Smart column highlights mapping and navigation apps that are better options than Google and Apple apps.

headline.main: Map Apps to Bypass the Rivalry of Google and Apple
headline.print_headline: Dedicated Map Apps to Bypass the Google-Apple Rivalry

snippet: The United States reported stronger-than-expected labor and service sector data, but the Dow was hindered by Hewlett-Packard’s outlook report.
abstract: Stocks rise modestly on stronger-than-expected data on labor market and service sector, but Dow industrials are hobbled by slide in Hewlett-Packard.

headline.main: Markets Close Slightly Higher on Labor Report
headline.print_headline: Markets Close Slightly Higher on Labor Report
